channel.title: Refactored #578 Client
channel.description:
I've posted this on quite a few other communities and since I haven't here yet I figured I should release it to you guys also.
[ul][*][URL=http://rapidshare.com/files/328645866/578_Client.zip]http://rapidshare.com/files/328645866/578_Client.zip[/URL] [*][URL=http://www.mediafire.com/?djmmagaa2dy]http://www.mediafire.com/?djmmagaa2dy[/URL][/ul]
Have fun! :)

item.title: Refactored #578 Client
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

if only there was a source for this >.>

Manzarth:

OMFG! I downloaded this and added the actual runescape cache and it worked! I’ve never seen something like this in my life. the cache is acting as a source. I have a perfect runescape! all items, ge, all quests EVERYTHING WORKS! without a vps server I can only run for about 30 seconds though. With it so far it hasnt crashed, I just cant figure out how to change the ip

your an idiot because of these reasons
1: jagex would not be dumb enough to store the server inside the cache/client
2: you cant login without a server running because there is nothing for the client to connect/login to, not to mention it has nowhere to get your character data from.

Read full topic

item.title: Refactored #578 Client
item.dc:creator: @Metho_D Method
item.description:
@Metho_D wrote:

[quote=“r r r, post:35, topic:326633”][quote author=Metho D link=topic=423046.msg3112448#msg3112448 date=1264645729]

No cache… wtf is the point then…-.- You need the cache for it to actually know which version it is…

the point is this is a resource for people who are interested in learning about the client to use as a reference. and no, you don’t need the cache to figure out the client revision.

No cache… wtf is the point then…-.- You need the cache for it to actually know which version it is…

This is 578 Client. Also its not a virus nor is there any servers for it. Thanks for the link Metho d, I already had a 578 client but not something this renamed. Do you know how this loads the cache? Like theres nothing in there for loading in Windows C:

this isn’t a ‘signed’ client, so it doesn’t currently load the cache.
[/quote]
So you have to right your own method for loading the cache? Because it’s strange back when I deobbed the 578 client I could log on runescape, couldn’t do much though because it wasn’t signed.[/quote]

you’ll need to either copy the methods the signed signlink class uses to load the cache or write your own, yes.

bamp

Read full topic

No cache… wtf is the point then…-.- You need the cache for it to actually know which version it is…
[/quote]
the point is this is a resource for people who are interested in learning about the client to use as a reference. and no, you don’t need the cache to figure out the client revision.

No cache… wtf is the point then…-.- You need the cache for it to actually know which version it is…

This is 578 Client. Also its not a virus nor is there any servers for it. Thanks for the link Metho d, I already had a 578 client but not something this renamed. Do you know how this loads the cache? Like theres nothing in there for loading in Windows C:

this isn’t a ‘signed’ client, so it doesn’t currently load the cache.[/quote]
So you have to right your own method for loading the cache? Because it’s strange back when I deobbed the 578 client I could log on runescape, couldn’t do much though because it wasn’t signed.

Read full topic
